title: Chrissy Teigen embraces her three-year-old daughter Luna
text:
She's working on her very own lifestyle website, Cravings.

And Chrissy Teigen shared behind-the-scenes shots of the work on Saturday, canoodling with her husband John Legend and daughter Luna alongside some delicious-looking meals.

The model-turned-foodie leaned back in both the shots - in one, on John's lap as she held Luna in her arms and another, on the floor with Luna in her arms.

Chrissy, 33, had various dishes arranged next to them including what looked like casseroles and veggies.

Precious: Chrissy Teigen shared behind-the-scenes shots of her upcoming food website entitled Cravings on Saturday that featured herself canoodling with her husband John Legend and daughter Luna alongside some delicious-looking meals

The Delta, Utah native captioned one of the photos: 'Working on the most epic holiday table to launch my site with!

'Didn't want it to just look like a bunch of Photoshopped dishes of the past so the team made and plated every single one (over 40!!) and you'll have the ability to drag and create the menu of your dreams!! a labor of LOVE but you guys are worth it!!! #CRAVINGS'

Chrissy captioned her next photo: '#CRAVINGS #sitecomingSOOOON!'

She made the first announcement that a website is on its way via Twitter in February.

Cute: The model-turned-chef leaned back in both the shots - in one, on John's lap as she held Luna in her arms and another, on the floor as Luna laid with her on her belly

'oh man...after mannnnnny years of talking about it and muccccch work by many extraordinary beings, I am finally going to have a WEBSITE on the INTERNETS!' she wrote.

She then asked followers for their input on which meals they would like to see made.

'I want to fill it with recipes upon your arrival (new! not the same from the books) - I would love for you to tell me what I should make! Please let me know here and I will screen grab and tag your questions or recipe requests on the site!!'

Official: She made the first announcement that a website is on its way via Twitter in February

The mom-of-two told Us Weekly that she's 'so excited' to get the project out in the open.

'There's gonna be this awesome question [section] where people can ask me things straight from the website or they can tweet them at me and we'll keep them all in a file, whether it's questions about cooking, relationships, kids,' she said.

And when it comes to answering questions, she plans to act as an open book.

'I don't care what it is, I'll answer anything,' she told the outlet.

A release date for the website has yet to be announced.
